item.title: About
item.description: This is a personal and professional webpage. (I am a personal and a professional person.) I teach American literature at Vilnius University. I try to improve my classes, my research, and my personal brand, as I can. I recently finished a dissertation on literatureâ€™s intersection with geographic knowledge-production in nineteenth-century America. It features chapters on Charles Brockden Brown, Margaret Fuller, and Emily Dickinson. I used to take photographs. I sometimes post here.

item.title: localauthor
item.description: Occasional short sketches on local fare and otherwise, offered freely.

item.title: poem-machine
item.description: Turning your favorite source text into the stock of your creations one random word at a time.

item.title: poem-machine-crawl
item.description: Wonder at the infinite crawl of the poem-machine. Currently Serving Up: Dickinson’s Poems (1890) Thoreau’s Walden Fuller’s Summer on the Lakes (1844) Some reports from the machine: https://localauthor.github.io/poem-machine-poems Or, visit the Github repository, to see the source code: https://github.com/localauthor/poem-machine-crawl

item.title: zk
item.description: An Emacs package for taking notes using the Zettelkasten method. Introduction and Key Features Demo of setup and basic features Demo of ‘Index’ and ‘Desktop’ interfaces
